identificationModule.briefTitle: The Clinical Trial of Chinese Herbal Medicine SaiLuoTong Capsule
identificationModule.officialTitle: Phase 2 Clinical Trial of SaiLuoTong Capsule for Vascular Dementia：A 26-week, Multicentre, Randomized, Double -Blind, Placebo-controlled Trial With a 26-week Open-label Extension

descriptionModule.briefSummary: As a traditional Chinese medicine compound, SaiLuoTong capsule is proven to have beneficial effects on learning and memory ability in animal models of vascular dementia (VaD). The study hypothesis is that SaiLuoTong capsule will be effective in the treatment of patients with VaD and will be well tolerated. The purpose of the study is to determine the efficacy and safety of SaiLuoTong capsule on patients with mild to moderate VaD. The outcome measures include general cognitive function, executive function, daily living skills, and mental behavior changes of symptoms in VaD patients.

armGroups.label: high dose group of SaiLuoTong capsule
armGroups.description: take three pills (180 mg) of SaiLuoTong capsule each time, twice a day, 0.5 hours after breakfast and dinner, taking with lukewarm water.
interventionNames: Drug: high dose group of SaiLuoTong capsule

armGroups.label: low dose group of SaiLuoTong capsule
armGroups.description: take two pills (120 mg) of SaiLuoTong capsule plus one pill of placebo (analog SaiLuoTong capsule) each time, twice a day, 0.5 hours after breakfast and dinner, taking with lukewarm water.
interventionNames: Drug: low dose group of SaiLuoTong

armGroups.label: the control group
armGroups.description: The control group is randomly divided into two groups by 1:1. During the first 26 weeks, all subjects will take three pills of placebo each time, twice a day. During the last 26 weeks, the subjects in the placebo group will take two pills of SaiLuoTong plus one pill of placebo or three pills of SaiLuoTong each time, twice a day.

primaryOutcomes.description: The V-ADAS-cog comprises the ADAS-cog plus the Maze and Number Cancellation test to specifically assess executive function.

The ADCS-CGIC involves comparison of data acquisition from both home and clinic and the use of both informant-ratings and self-ratings. Important outcomes include clinical global impressions of change (CGIC) as indicators of clinically meaningful change.

secondaryOutcomes.description: An inventory to assess the patient's ability to do basic activities of daily living and instrumental activities of daily living.
The MMSE is a global test of cognitive function, for which the total score ranges from 0 to 30, with higher scores indicating lesser severity.
The CDR is a numeric scale used to quantify the severity of symptoms of dementia (i.e. its 'stage').
It was designed to elicit executive impairment and to discriminate it from non-executive constructional failure.
The C-EXIT25 is a measure of executive function based on a 15-min interview addressing 25 items related to executive cognition.

The NPI is used to assess neuropsychiatric symptoms. The NPI uses a screening strategy to minimize administration time, examining and scoring only those behavioral domains with positive responses to screening questions.
CDR-sb is the sum of boxes of CDR, with higher scores indicating severer degree of impairment.
